body_html:
@taion This is a solved issue. Consider using tf.keras to build your models. In all layers from tf.keras.layers that take a data_format argument, the default will be keras.backend.image_data_format() (which you can set via keras.backend.set_image_data_format('channels_...') or via your Keras settings files). This allows you to build models that work for either data format, without changing anything.

Agreed that we should extend support to BatchNormalization.

body:
@taion This is a solved issue. Consider using `tf.keras` to build your models. In all layers from `tf.keras.layers` that take a `data_format` argument, the default will be `keras.backend.image_data_format()` (which you can set via `keras.backend.set_image_data_format('channels_...')` or via your Keras settings files). This allows you to build models that work for either data format, without changing anything.

Agreed that we should extend support to `BatchNormalization`.
